title: Range: Why Generalists Triumph in a Specialized World
author: David Epstein
description: A compelling argument for why breadth of experience and late specialization often beat early focus. Epstein draws on research and stories from sports, music, science, and business to show how generalists find their path and thrive in a complex world.

title: Shoe Dog: A Memoir by the Creator of Nike
author: Phil Knight
description: Phil Knight's candid memoir of building Nike from a $50 loan into a global brand. A raw, honest account of the early struggles, near-bankruptcies, and relentless drive that defined the company's scrappy beginnings.
